item.title: Army Ready to Wrap Up and State Government Not Yet In, Jammu Camps Head for Chaos
item.description: After nearly 10 days, people in parts of flood-ravaged Jammu have started on the long way home. So has the army. But the ones who should be take charge of the remaining relief camps, officials of the ...

item.title: US Wins Diplomatic Support for Campaign in Iraq; Syria Trickier
item.description: World powers backed military measures on Monday to help defeat Islamic State fighters in Iraq, boosting Washington's efforts to set up a coalition, but made no mention of the tougher diplomatic challe...

item.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger Meets Jayalalithaa in Chennai
item.description: Hollywood star Arnold Schwarzenegger had a blockbuster meeting with Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa in Chennai today.

item.title: Ahead of Chinese President's Visit, A Fresh Transgression by China in Ladakh
item.description: Ahead of Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit on September 17, a fresh transgression by the Chinese army has been reported in Ladakh.

item.title: Champions League Twenty20: Mumbai Indians Pacer Praveen Kumar Ruled Out
item.description: Praveen Kumar suffered an injury to his right shoulder during Mumbai Indians' opening qualifying game against Lahore Lions. Left-arm pace bowler Pawan Suyal has been included in the squad.

item.title: In Ranchi, BJP Leaders Attend Amit Shah's Five-Point Lecture
item.description: New BJP president Amit Shah, now touring election-bound states, has reportedly been doing some plain speaking with top local party leaders.

item.title: France Begins Reconnaissance Flights Over Iraq
item.description: French planes carried out their first reconnaissance flights over Iraq on Monday in support of the US-led campaign against Islamic State jihadists.

item.title: CLT20: KXIP's Mitchell Johnson Waiting for CA's Clearance
item.description: Kings XI Punjab could be without their strike bowler Mitchell Johnson who is currently injured and awaits a clearance from Cricket Australia.

item.title: IIM Calcutta Ranked Best B-School in Asia
item.description: The premier Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Calcutta has been ranked as the best B-school from Asia in the FT Masters in Management Global Rankings.

item.title: Senior Bihar BJP Leaders Divided Over Nitish Kumar's Alleged Involvement in Scam
item.description: A tussle has broken out within the Bihar BJP over allegations levelled against former Chief Minister and Janata Dal United leader Nitish Kumar in a multi-crore scam related to the purchase of medical ...

item.title: Trying Our Best For an Alliance With BJP, Says Shiv Sena Chief Uddhav Thackeray
item.description: The Shiv Sena wants to contest nothing less than 155 of Maharashtra's 288 seats.

item.title: Opinion: Deepika's Cleavage is As Important As SRK's Eight-Pack, Writes Shobhaa De
item.description: Deepika's Cleavage is As Important As SRK's Eight-Pack, Writes Shobhaa De

item.title: Abdul Razzaq Backs Shahid Afridi as Limited-Overs Captain
item.description: Pakistan Cricket Board is set to announce the new T20 captain on Tuesday. Shahid Afridi was removed as captain of the ODI and T20 teams in 2011.

item.title: 2G Scam: Congress' Sanjay Nirupam Sends Legal Notice to Former CAG Vinod Rai
item.description: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam has sent a legal notice to former auditor Vinod Rai over allegations that he tried to pressure him in the spectrum scam case asking the former watchdog to issue an uncon...

item.title: Want to Leave the Game on High Like Pele, Ali: Paes
item.description: Leander Paes said he was targeting a medal at the 2016 Rio Olympics before bidding farewell to his illustrious career that fetched him 14 Grand Slam titles and an Olympic bronze medal in singles.

item.title: I Want a Full Stop for Myself in Delhi Politics: Sheila Dikshit to NDTV
item.description: Senior Congress leader and former Delhi Chief Minister, Sheila Dikshit today stood by her comments that if BJP has the numbers, they should be asked to prove it on floor of the house.

item.title: In a First, Andhra Pradesh Holds Paperless Cabinet Meet
item.description: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu is trying hard to keep up with his image of 'CEO of Andhra Pradesh Inc.' that he had crafted for himself in his earlier tenure.

item.title: Inflation Drops to Five-Year Low on Fall in Fuel, Food Prices
item.description: Food prices cooled off sharply on the back of a drastic fall in vegetable prices including onions, which dropped nearly 45 per cent year-on-year. As a result, food inflation eased to 5.15 per cent aga...

item.title: Lehman Collapse: Six Years on India Still Feels After-Effects
item.description: Within three months of Lehman's collapse, the BSE Sensex crashed to 8,535 in the wake of global finance crisis, plunging 60 per cent from around 21,000 levels in January 2008.

item.title: J&K Floods: Food, Medicine Should Reach the Last Man, Says Supreme Court
item.description: Food, drinking water and medical facilities should reach even the last man in flood-hit Jammu and Kashmir, the Supreme Court told the Centre and the state government today.

item.title: 'Who Gave You List of CBI Chief's Visitors?' Supreme Court Asks Prashant Bhushan
item.description: The Supreme Court today asked lawyer-activist Prashant Bhushan to reveal who gave him a list of visitors to CBI Director Ranjit Sinha's home. Mr Sinha, who has been accused of compromising scam invest...

item.title: Google Launches Android One Smartphones With Micromax, Karbonn, Spice
item.description: Google has launched the Android One platform in India, with smartphones from its three launch partners - Karbonn, Micromax and Spice.

item.title: Woman Claims Kolkata Restaurant Barred Her for Being a Rape Survivor, Files FIR
item.description: A woman, who has alleged that she was denied entry into a Kolkata restaurant on Saturday for being a rape survivor, has filed a First Information Report against the eatery.

item.title: Android One Was Conceived With India in Mind, Says Google's Sundar Pichai
item.description: NDTV Group CEO Vikram Chandra speaks exclusively to Google's Senior V-P Android, Chrome and Apps Sundar Pichai about the company's new platform Android One.
